title: 114_hr1901
content: The "PTC Elimination Act" is the short title of the Act that phases out and repeals the credit for electricity produced from certain renewable resources. The Act phases out the credit for electricity produced from renewable resources, with reductions in credit and phaseout amounts effective after December 31, 2015. A special rule for determining the beginning of construction is also introduced. The Act introduces a special rule for determining the beginning of construction for renewable energy facilities. It also repeals the credit for electricity produced from renewable resources. The Act includes conforming amendments to various sections of the tax code related to renewable energy provisions. The Act includes conforming amendments to various sections of the tax code related to renewable energy provisions. The amendments made by this subsection apply to electricity and refined coal produced and sold after December 31, 2025. The Congress believes that the tax credit under section 45 of the Internal Revenue Code should expire as scheduled and not be extended further. SEC. 3. REDUCTION OF CORPORATE INCOME TAX. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include a new subsection that reduces the amount of tax imposed on taxpayers for taxable years beginning more than 1 year after the enactment of the subsection. The reduction is based on an applicable percentage estimated by the Secretary to decrease revenues to the Treasury. The new subsection in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 reduces tax for taxable years starting more than 1 year after enactment. The applicable percentage, determined by the Secretary, will decrease Treasury revenues. The amendment applies to taxable years beginning more than 1 year after the Act's enactment.
